text:
I would like another field on the javac task.

The reason is there is no way, currently that I can see to pass in extra command line parameters to the compiler.

Specifically the need arises in order to use the -X commands. As these commands are not guaranteed to be in the next release of the compiler, I would simply like a line argument similar to the arg element on the java task.

The problem comes around when the compiler runs out of heap and requests the the use of the -MX<size> argument on the compiler invocation.

Thanks

Don
creator: donald.m.stewart@btinternet.com

text: I second that. This is especially useful when using the 1.1.8 compiler.
creator: arunkv@gmail.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
As long as you don't fork javac, memory settings here wouldn't affect the 
heap used (as the compiler will be run in the same VM Ant is running in).  In 
Ant 1.4 we have memoryInitialSize and memoryMaxSize attributes that will take 
care of that.

Are there any other additional argumnets you'd like to pass to javac?
